question.title: Error stream is empty when running bash script
question.body:
I am trying to capture the error stream of a process, but the stream is empty, despite an error message showing up.

This is what I tried. If the .ksh file is not present, an error message shows up with "No such file or directory" from bash, but this message is not present in the error stream. How can I retrieve that message?

try {
    String[] command = {"bash", "test123.ksh"};
    Process process = new ProcessBuilder(command)
            .inheritIO()
            .start();

    StringBuilder stdErr = new StringBuilder();
    BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(process.getErrorStream()));
    String line;
    while ((line = reader.readLine()) != null) {
        stdErr.append(line);
        stdErr.append("\n");
        System.out.println(line);
    }

    process.waitFor();

} catch (IOException | InterruptedException e) {
    throw new RuntimeException(e);
}

answers.body:
inheritIO() means the subprocess’s stderr goes to the Java program’s stderr, which means getErrorStream() will not contain any bytes at all.

If you want the subprocess to use the same input/output descriptors as the Java process, except for standard error, use this:

.inheritIO().redirectError(ProcessBuilder.Redirect.PIPE)
